translated: Having thus explained the first benefit of the secret conduct, the second benefit is the attainment of the powers of all tantras, as taught in the Compendium of Principles, the Cakrasaṃvara, the All Secret, the Shriparamādya, and the Vajrabhairava.

original: bzlas pa dang brtul zhugs dang spyod pa la sogs pas grub pa ni 'dir gtsang sbra gsum gyi bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gis grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang brtul zhugs dang spyod pa la sogs pas grub pa ni 'dir gtsang sbra gsum gyi bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gis grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The powers attained through recitation, conduct, and so forth are attained in an instant through the meditative stabilization of the three purities.

original: de ltar phan yon gnyis pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phan yon gnyis pa bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the second benefit,

original: grol ba'i lam pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: grol ba'i lam pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
translated: the benefit of the path of liberation is taught.

original: rnal 'byor lam pa dga' bas kyang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor lam pa dga' bas kyang //
translated: The yogi/nī on the path of joy🔽also

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽

original: rnal 'byor gyi lam ni chos dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgom pa grol ba'i lam yin pas phyag rgya de nyid la brten nas gtsang sbra 'di yang dag par spyod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi lam ni chos dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgom pa grol ba'i lam yin pas phyag rgya de nyid la brten nas gtsang sbra 'di yang dag par spyod do //
translated: The path of yoga is the path of liberation, the meditation on the reality and pledge seals. Therefore, based on those seals, this purity is also perfectly practiced.

original: grol ba'i lam pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: grol ba'i lam pa de'i bsod nams ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the merit of the path of liberation?

original: gtsang sbra las byung ba'i yon tan rgya chen po de ni gang zag stong phrag du mas kha stong phrag du ma'i sgo nas yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra las byung ba'i yon tan rgya chen po de ni gang zag stong phrag du mas kha stong phrag du ma'i sgo nas yon tan brjod kyis mi lang ba'o //
translated: The great quality that arises from purity is not to be described by many thousands of people with many thousands of mouths.

original: yon tan gsum pa bshad nas mchod pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: yon tan gsum pa bshad nas mchod pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: Having explained the third quality, the benefit of worship is:

original: dpal ldan khrag 'thung ye shes che //
analyzed: dpal ldan khrag 'thung ye shes che //
translated: The glorious great wisdom blood-drinker.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dpal bde mchog gi rnam shes dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dpal bde mchog gi rnam shes dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara is consciousness and wisdom.

original: rnam dag mtshan nyid ni kun sgrub pa la ni rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dag mtshan nyid ni kun sgrub pa la ni rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'o //
translated: The pure characteristic is free from the eighty inherent concepts.

original: bde ba'i bsod nams chu 'thungs pa'i //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i bsod nams chu 'thungs pa'i // zhes pa ni /
translated: Drinking the water of blissful merit,

original: byang chub kyi sems bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bzlog pa'o //
translated: this is the reversal of bodhicitta.

original: dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed yin //
analyzed: dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed yin //
translated: It is the purifier, the destroyer of evil,

original: zhes pa ni rnam shes kyi bsam gtan gyi sdig pa dag cing sems kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam shes kyi bsam gtan gyi sdig pa dag cing sems kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'dag pa'o //
translated: this purifies the evil of the concentration of consciousness and purifies the afflictions of the mind and the obscurations of the object of knowledge.

original: de ltar chags pa'i lam pa'i phan yon bzhi pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chags pa'i lam pa'i phan yon bzhi pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the four benefits of the path of passion,

original: lnga pa chos kyi phyag rgya'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lnga pa chos kyi phyag rgya'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
translated: the fifth, the teaching of the benefits of the seal of Dharma is stated:

original: reg pa dang ni smras pas kyang //
analyzed: reg pa dang ni smras pas kyang //
translated: By touching and by speaking

original: sdig pa kun las grol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs @410a * //
analyzed: sdig pa kun las grol bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs @410a * //
translated: one is freed from all evil.🔽When one focuses on the seal of Dharma by speaking, hearing with the ear, up to touching with the body, one is freed from evil.

original: te ; smra ba rna bas thos pa nas reg pa lus kyis myong ba'i bar gyis chos kyi phyag rgya la dmigs na sdig pa las grol bar 'gyur zhing mig gi yul gzugs su dag cing skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: te ; smra ba rna bas thos pa nas reg pa lus kyis myong ba'i bar gyis chos kyi phyag rgya la dmigs na sdig pa las grol bar 'gyur zhing mig gi yul gzugs su dag cing skyon med pa'o //
translated: The object of the eye is pure form, free from faults.

original: gzugs la rtog pa dang bral ba'i bde ba skyes nas gang zhig spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la rtog pa dang bral ba'i bde ba skyes nas gang zhig spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When the bliss free from conceptualization of form arises, one practices.

original: mchog gi dngos grub bde bar gshegs pa'i sa bcu gcig pa thob pa dang bde bar gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i lha'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub bde bar gshegs pa'i sa bcu gcig pa thob pa dang bde bar gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i lha'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: One attains the supreme power, the eleventh stage of the Sugata, and becomes a king of gods born in the family of the Sugata.

original: dngos grub 'bring dang mi'i rgyal por gyur ba'i dngos grub tha ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos grub 'bring dang mi'i rgyal por gyur ba'i dngos grub tha ma yin no //
translated: The middling power is becoming a king of humans, and the lesser power is becoming a king of animals.

original: de ltar brtul zhugs phan yon dang bcas pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar brtul zhugs phan yon dang bcas pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the observances together with their benefits,

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtor ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtor ma bshad pa ni /
translated: he explains the sacrificial cake of the wheel of the gaṇa.

original: de ltar tu mchod byas nas //
analyzed: de ltar tu mchod byas nas //
translated: Having worshipped in that way,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says,

original: mchod pa ni gtsang sbra gsum gyis mchod pa'o //🔽dad pa yis ni gtor ma sbyin ;
analyzed: mchod pa ni gtsang sbra gsum gyis mchod pa'o // dad pa yis ni gtor ma sbyin ;
translated: worship with the three purities.

original: / zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la mos pa yid kyi dad pa dang / de'i bstan pa bsrung ba la dad pa dang / de'i bstan pa bsrung ba la dad pas 'khor gsum dag pa'i gtor ma gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la mos pa yid kyi dad pa dang / de'i bstan pa bsrung ba la dad pa dang / de'i bstan pa bsrung ba la dad pas 'khor gsum dag pa'i gtor ma gtang bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer the sacrificial cake that is pure of the three spheres with mental faith in the Three Jewels, faith in protecting their doctrine, and faith in protecting the doctrine of the Three Jewels.

original: ji bzhin cho ga'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: ji bzhin cho ga'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: With the application of the rite just as it is,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dus su bdag nyid rnal 'byor ba bzhis lhar bskyed pa dang ci 'byor ba'i rdzas la yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du kam gsum las bskyed pa'i thod pa'i sgyed pu dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dus su bdag nyid rnal 'byor ba bzhis lhar bskyed pa dang ci 'byor ba'i rdzas la yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du kam gsum las bskyed pa'i thod pa'i sgyed pu dang /
translated: he says. At the time of the wheel of the gaṇa, one should generate oneself as the deity with the four yogas, and with whatever substances one has, one should generate the wind mandala from yaṃ, the fire mandala from raṃ, and the tripod of skulls generated from the three kaṃs above that.

original: yi ge kam las bskyed pa'i thod pa stong gsum gyi tshad tsam bsams la bdud rtsi lnga'i gang bu yi ge lnga dang / aom aa: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: yi ge kam las bskyed pa'i thod pa stong gsum gyi tshad tsam bsams la bdud rtsi lnga'i gang bu yi ge lnga dang / aom aa: h'um gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Having visualized a skull-cup generated from the letter kaṃ and the size of the three-thousand-fold-world-realm, filled with the five elixirs and the five letters, and consecrated with the three letters oṃ āḥ hūṃ,🔽one should transform ordinary food into divine food, and fill it with the elixir of exalted wisdom.

original: tha mal ba'i kha zas dag cing lha'i kha zas su zhu ba dang / ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang bar byas pa brtan par byed pa'i sngags 'dis //
analyzed: tha mal ba'i kha zas dag cing lha'i kha zas su zhu ba dang / ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang bar byas pa brtan par byed pa'i sngags 'dis //
translated: One should stabilize it with this mantra of stabilization:

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dha rmm'a n'am a'adya nutpa nna tv'ata ces bya ba lan lnga'i bar du byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dha rmm'a n'am a'adya nutpa nna tv'ata ces bya ba lan lnga'i bar du byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: oṃ āḥ kāra-mukhaṃ sarva-dharmāṇām adya-anutpannatva-tva

original: de'i mdun du ae gru gsum gyi dbus su bhru'um las gzhal yas khang bskyed la /
analyzed: de'i mdun du ae gru gsum gyi dbus su bhru'um las gzhal yas khang bskyed la /
translated: Having consecrated it in this way five times, in front of it, in the center of an e triangle, one should generate the celestial mansion from bhrūṃ.

original: dbus su bcom ldan 'das 'byung bo thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i phyag tu bum pa bsams la /
analyzed: dbus su bcom ldan 'das 'byung bo thams cad 'dul bar byed pa'i phyag tu bum pa bsams la /

original: de'i @410b shar du nag po /
analyzed: de'i @410b shar du nag po /

original: byang du ru dra chen po /
analyzed: byang du ru dra chen po /
translated: in the north, great Rudra;

original: nub tu lha sbyin /
analyzed: nub tu lha sbyin /
translated: in the west, Devadatta;

original: lhor nag po /🔽dbang ldan du gtsigs pa /
analyzed: lhor nag po /🔽dbang ldan du gtsigs pa /
translated: in the south, Kāla;🔽in the northeast, Bhīṣaṇa;

original: me'i mtshams su mi srun pa /
analyzed: me'i mtshams su mi srun pa /
translated: In the southeast is the fierce one.

original: bden bral du dga' ba las 'das pa /
analyzed: bden bral du dga' ba las 'das pa /
translated: In the southwest is the one beyond joy.🔽In the northwest is the one who leads astray.

analyzed: rlung du log 'dren te thams cad kyang zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa /

original: phyag bzhi pa /🔽gri gug dang thod pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa / gri gug dang thod pa /
translated: and four arms.🔽They hold a flaying knife and skull cup,

analyzed: kha tv'am ga dang mdung rtse gsum pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: a khaṭvāṅga and a trident.

original: gnag pa dang ser ba dang / dmar ba dang dkar ba'i mdog can /
analyzed: gnag pa dang ser ba dang / dmar ba dang dkar ba'i mdog can /
translated: They are black, yellow, red, and white.

original: mtshams na gnas pa yid 'phrog pa'i gzugs gnyis pa shar phyogs kyi nag po chen po la tsa munda dang / drag mo dang / mi sdug ma dang / bka' zlog ma bzhis bskor ba'o //

analyzed: byang gi ru dra las rgyal ma dang / rnam rgyal ma dang / mi thub ma dang / gzhan gyis mi thub mas bskor ba'o //
translated: in the north, Rudra-jayā is surrounded by Vijayā, Aparājitā, and Aparājitā;

original: nub kyi lha sbyin la bzang mo dang / nag sbom ma dang / nag chen ma dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o ;
analyzed: nub kyi lha sbyin la bzang mo dang / nag sbom ma dang / nag chen ma dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o ;
translated: in the west, Vasu is surrounded by Bhadrā, Kṛṣṇāṭṭā, Mahākṛṣṇā, and Yoginī;🔽and in the south, Mahābala is surrounded by Mahābalā, Balavatī, and Balaprabhāva.

original: / lhor nag po la dbang mo dang / zla ba mo dang / drag mo dang / sdang ba mo rnams kyis bskor ba'o //🔽dbang ldan du gtsigs pa la 'phyang ma dang / dbang phyug ma dang / skam po che dang / mar me ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o //

translated: In the south, black [Yamari] is surrounded by Isvari, Candra, Rudra, and Dvesvari.🔽In the northeast, [Yamari] with bared fangs is surrounded by Kinkini, Isvari, Mahaka, and Dlpa.

original: me mtshams kyi mi srun ma la 'joms ma dang / grong khyer ma dang / gzugs drag mo dang / gzugs chen ma bzhis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: me mtshams kyi mi srun ma la 'joms ma dang / grong khyer ma dang / gzugs drag mo dang / gzugs chen ma bzhis bskor ba'o //

analyzed: bden bral du dga' ba las 'das pa la mche ba can dang / gtsigs ma dang / thod phreng ma dang / kha tr'am can rnams kyis bskor ba'o //
translated: In the southwest, beyond joy, is surrounded by Daksina, Ugra, Kapalinl, and Khatvanga.

original: rlung du log 'dren la ral gri can dang / dgra sta can dang / rdo rje can ma dang / gzhu can ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rlung du log 'dren la ral gri can dang / dgra sta can dang / rdo rje can ma dang / gzhu can ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o //

analyzed: zhi ba la thams cad dkar po / rgyas pa la thams cad ser po /

original: mngon spyod la thams cad nag po /
analyzed: mngon spyod la thams cad nag po /

analyzed: lha mo sum cu rtsa gnyis ni thams cad kyang gri gug dang ka p'a la bsnams pa /

analyzed: dru khrod brgyad kyi phyogs skyong ba ni @411a * //
translated: The directional guardians of the eight charnel grounds

original: shar du rdo rje /
analyzed: shar du rdo rje /

original: lhor ral gri /
analyzed: lhor ral gri /
translated: a sword in the south,

original: nub tu zhags pa /
analyzed: nub tu zhags pa /
translated: a noose in the west,

original: byang du dbyug pa thogs pa /
analyzed: byang du dbyug pa thogs pa /

original: phrin las bzhi'i mdog can no //
analyzed: phrin las bzhi'i mdog can no //

analyzed: ae a'a ralli he zhes bya ba'i sngags dang skye gnas kyi phyag rgyas spyan drangs pa la mchod pa dbul lo //

analyzed: de lta bu'i mgron bsams nas dus nam gyi tshe mchod ce na /

analyzed: myur du 'bad pas mchod bya ste // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: The tenth day is the day of the field goddess, the second day is the day of the nearby field goddess, the third day is the day of the field, the fourth day is the day of the nearby field, the fifth day is the day of the caṇḍola, the sixth day is the day of the nearby caṇḍola,

original: bdun pa la 'du sa dang / brgyad pa la nye ba'i 'du sa dang / dgu pa la dur khrod dang / bcu pa la nye ba'i dur khrod kyi lha mo tshang bar gyur ba'i tshe mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la 'du sa dang / brgyad pa la nye ba'i 'du sa dang / dgu pa la dur khrod dang / bcu pa la nye ba'i dur khrod kyi lha mo tshang bar gyur ba'i tshe mchod par bya'o //
translated: the seventh day is the day of the assembly, the eighth day is the day of the nearby assembly, the ninth day is the day of the charnel ground, and the tenth day is the day of the nearby charnel ground.

original: cis mchod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: cis mchod par bya zhe na /
translated: By what should one make offerings?

original: rdo rje lha mo myos byed shas //
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo myos byed shas //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: lo bcu drug ma'i snying dang / sha dang chang gis so //

analyzed: su zhig la zhe na /

original: skye bo dad pas mchod bya zhing //
analyzed: skye bo dad pas mchod bya zhing //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ste tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mo la'o //

analyzed: ci zhig sgom zhing zhe na /

original: he ru ka dpal lo //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal lo //

original: ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi?

original: mngon par dga' ba zhi gnas dang / gus pa'i sems lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba zhi gnas dang / gus pa'i sems lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: The samādhi of calm abiding and insight, with a mind of devotion and delight.🔽Abiding in those, the supreme place is not robbed,

original: de rnams la gnas mchog mi 'phrog / ces bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang gtor ma byas nas dngos grub gzhan gyis 'phrog par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la gnas mchog mi 'phrog / ces bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang gtor ma byas nas dngos grub gzhan gyis 'phrog par mi nus pa'o //
translated: means that having performed the ganacakra and bali, the siddhis cannot be robbed by others.

original: spyod lam ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: spyod lam ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the conduct?

original: mtshan mo'i brtul zhugs can gtor ma //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i brtul zhugs can gtor ma //
translated: The one with the conduct of the night, the bali.

original: skra grol gcer bur gyur bas sbyin //
analyzed: skra grol gcer bur gyur bas sbyin //
translated: Giving with loose hair and naked.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phan yon ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: phan yon ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit?

original: shr'i he ru ka bdag sbyor bas /
analyzed: shr'i he ru ka bdag sbyor bas /
translated: By my union with Shrī Heruka,

original: rnal 'byor ma nyid mnyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma nyid mnyes par 'gyur //
translated: the yoginīs themselves are pleased.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽dpal he ru ka'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa sa rdo rje thal mo gye na du kha phye la aom kha kh'a hi zhes bya ba nas sa h'a yi k'a bha bantu zhes bya ba'i bar du bsngo zhing mgron rnams kyi lce la rdo rje @411b rtse lnga
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / dpal he ru ka'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa sa rdo rje thal mo gye na du kha phye la aom kha kh'a hi zhes bya ba nas sa h'a yi k'a bha bantu zhes bya ba'i bar du bsngo zhing mgron rnams kyi lce la rdo rje @411b rtse lnga
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: pa'i sbu gus gtor ma 'thung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i sbu gus gtor ma 'thung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: Endowed with the union of Shrī Heruka, one should open the vajra palms and recite the mantra from “Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi” up to “sahāyaikabhāvantu,” and imagine that the guests drink the bali through the tube of the five-pronged vajra at their tongues.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the twenty-seventh chapter.

original: // / de ltar rang don phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ston pa ni /🔽de nas mchod pa rnam dag pa //
analyzed: // / de ltar rang don phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ston pa ni / de nas mchod pa rnam dag pa //
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of one’s own welfare, the perfection of others’ welfare is taught:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Then, the pure worship” and so on.

original: mchod pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste gtsang sbra rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mchod pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste gtsang sbra rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Worship is the worship of practice, the three purities.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Pure” means free from the eighty natural impurities.

original: sprul pa las byung dpa' bo rnams //
analyzed: sprul pa las byung dpa' bo rnams //
translated: The heroes born from the emanations

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yul lha mo drug cu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yul lha mo drug cu'o //
translated: The sixty goddesses are the objects of worship.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yab yum la yang mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yab yum la yang mchod pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one should worship the glorious Heruka and his consort, oneself.

original: sangs rgyas kun sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa bum pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun sogs zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa bum pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: All the buddhas, etc. , are Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi appearing in the form of the vase.

original: sogs zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma'o //
translated: The etc. refers to the dakinis, lamas, ghouls, and rakshasas.

original: sras bcas zhes bya ba la sras ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sras bcas zhes bya ba la sras ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The sons refers to the twenty-four heroes.

original: bcas zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: bcas zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: The etc. refers to the thirty-six dakinis.

original: dpa' bo kun dang rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: dpa' bo kun dang rnal 'byor ma //
translated: All the heroes and yoginis

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar sras bcas zhes bya ba'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar sras bcas zhes bya ba'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the etc. is the same as that of the sons.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ni gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ni gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: The animate and inanimate refers to the animate as the heroes and yoginis, and the inanimate as the celestial mansion.

original: g-yo ba ni brten pa lha'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni brten pa lha'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The moving one is the divine wheel of support.

original: zla ba 'dus pa la gnas pas //
analyzed: zla ba 'dus pa la gnas pas //
translated: Abiding in the gathering of the moon,

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yul de rnams la gtsang sbra gsum gyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yul de rnams la gtsang sbra gsum gyis mchod pa'o //
translated: means that one should worship those objects of worship with the three purities.

original: mchod pa'i yul gyi lha de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na ;
analyzed: mchod pa'i yul gyi lha de rnams ji lta bu yin zhe na ;
translated: What are the deities that are the objects of worship?

original: spun dang sdug pa mchod pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spun dang sdug pa mchod pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The worship of the brothers and sisters.

original: dri'i thig le dang / me tog gi tshom bu dang / yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan dang / lag pa'i phyag rgya dang / sku phyag rgya chen po bkod pa rnams spangs nas dpa' bo dang / dpa' mo lhar bsgom pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ste spun ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang sdug pa ni lha mo sum cu rtsa drug go //🔽de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dri'i thig le dang / me tog gi tshom bu dang / yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan dang / lag pa'i phyag rgya dang / sku phyag rgya chen po bkod pa rnams spangs nas dpa' bo dang / dpa' mo lhar bsgom pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ste spun ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang sdug pa ni lha mo sum cu rtsa drug go // de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: means that, having abandoned the arrangement of drops of perfume, heaps of flowers, seed syllables and hand implements, hand gestures, and great seals of the body, the divine wheel is the meditation on the deities of the heroes and heroines. The brothers are the twenty-four heroes, and the sisters are the thirty-six goddesses.🔽Having explained that in brief, now, the extensive explanation is as follows.

original: thog mar rten gyi gang zag ston pa las de yang dngos por bya ba'i gang zag bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thog mar rten gyi gang zag ston pa las de yang dngos por bya ba'i gang zag bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the person who is the support is taught.

original: spun dang bu dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: spun dang bu dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with one’s brother and son.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: @412a * // spun ni 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
analyzed: @412a * // spun ni 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
translated: A brother is known in the world.

original: bu ni rigs rgyud bsrung ba'o //🔽de dang lhan cig tu 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'byung bas rang la brnyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir sngags te tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang / de bzhin du phyag rgya ni ba'i btung ba dang /
analyzed: bu ni rigs rgyud bsrung ba'o // de dang lhan cig tu 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'byung bas rang la brnyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir sngags te tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang / de bzhin du phyag rgya ni ba'i btung ba dang /
translated: A son is one who preserves the family line.🔽Together with them, one should not reveal the mantra, i.e., the gaṇa-cakras, and likewise the mudrā, i.e., the drinking of liquor,

original: ye shes ni pho nya'i gtsang sbra ste de rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni pho nya'i gtsang sbra ste de rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: and the knowledge, i.e., the messenger’s purity, because of the arising of the three and eight worldly joys and sorrows in oneself.

original: su la bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: su la bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: To whom should it be revealed?

original: dag byed zas la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: dag byed zas la spyod pa ni /
translated: The one who practices the purifying food

original: rtag tu dam tshig spyad byas 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig spyad byas 'gyur //
translated: will always practice the commitments.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dag byed kyi zas ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
analyzed: dag byed kyi zas ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
translated: The purifying food is the five sense objects of the gaṇa-cakras.

original: rtag tu dam tshig byed pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig byed pa ni /
translated: The one who always practices the commitments

original: bza' bar byed pa'i dam tshig ste rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral bas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa'o //🔽gsang sngags su la'ang bstan mi bya //
analyzed: bza' bar byed pa'i dam tshig ste rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral bas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa'o // gsang sngags su la'ang bstan mi bya //
translated: The pledge of what is to be consumed is to enjoy the five sense objects without the eighty natural thought states.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i btung ba mi bstan pa'o //🔽man ngag rnams ni nyams mi bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i btung ba mi bstan pa'o // man ngag rnams ni nyams mi bya //
translated: The pledge not to reveal the secret is not to reveal the secret of the drinking of the elixir.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i man ngag go //
translated: The pledge not to transgress the instructions is the instruction for conferring the initiation of the pristine awareness through wisdom.

original: gtsang sbra gsum po de sbyin par bya ba'i gnas ji lta bu zhe na /🔽dam tshig rnams la ci rigs par //
analyzed: gtsang sbra gsum po de sbyin par bya ba'i gnas ji lta bu zhe na / dam tshig rnams la ci rigs par //
translated: What kind of recipient is to be given these three purities?🔽The pledge to observe the pledges appropriately.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The pledge to observe the pledges appropriately is as follows:

original: rig pa'i dbang bskur ba la dpa' bo gcig pu sbyin pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sbyin pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pa la mi zab pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang bskur ba la dpa' bo gcig pu sbyin pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sbyin pa dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pa la mi zab pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa dang /
translated: The single hero pledge is to be given to one who is to be conferred the initiation of the knowledge consort. The wheel of the mandala pledge is to be given to one who is to be conferred the irreversible initiation. The stage of completion that is not profound is to be taught to one who has received the secret initiation.

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa la zab pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa la zab pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni ci rigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The profound completion stage is the “appropriate” for one who has obtained the empowerment of the wisdom-knowledge.

original: man ngag rnams kyang sbyin par bya //
analyzed: man ngag rnams kyang sbyin par bya //
translated: The instructions should also be given.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyis bde ba stong pa nyid la nges par 'dren pa'i thabs /🔽bla mas slob ma'i rna drung du //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi gzhan don gyis bde ba stong pa nyid la nges par 'dren pa'i thabs / bla mas slob ma'i rna drung du //
translated: This is the method of leading to certainty in emptiness, the bliss of the direct benefit of others.🔽The guru should explain

original: rab tu 'bad de bshad par bya //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad de bshad par bya //
translated: in the ear of the disciple with great effort.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar blang bya dang dor bya'i rten gyi gang zag bstan nas sbyor ba'i mchod pa gzhan las bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar blang bya dang dor bya'i rten gyi gang zag bstan nas sbyor ba'i mchod pa gzhan las bshad pa ni /
translated: Thus, having explained the person who is the basis of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, the other offerings of practice are explained.

original: pho nya ma gtogs gzhan dag la //
analyzed: pho nya ma gtogs gzhan dag la //
translated: Except for the messenger,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said.

original: dbang ma bskur ba dang bsnyen sgrub bzhis ma sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ma bskur ba dang bsnyen sgrub bzhis ma sbyangs pa'o //
translated: One who has not been empowered and who has not trained with the four sessions of approach and accomplishment.

original: 'dod la rmongs pas bgrod mi bya //
analyzed: 'dod la rmongs pas bgrod mi bya //
translated: One should not go out of ignorance of desire.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ni rnam par shes pa la @412b zhen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ni rnam par shes pa la @412b zhen pa'o //
translated: Desire is attachment to consciousness.

original: rmongs pa ni ye shes la rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni ye shes la rmongs pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is ignorance of wisdom.

original: bgrod mi bya ni rnam shes dang ye shes la sems pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: bgrod mi bya ni rnam shes dang ye shes la sems pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not travel means one should not think about consciousness and intuition.

original: de ltar dor bya'i pho nya bsgrub pa mdor bstan nas sa blang bya mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dor bya'i pho nya bsgrub pa mdor bstan nas sa blang bya mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus briefly explained the messenger to be rejected, the brief explanation of the earth to be taken up is:

original: pho nya mo zhen rtag thar pa /
analyzed: pho nya mo zhen rtag thar pa /
translated: The messenger is always to be enjoyed,

original: lnga pa yis kyang longs spyod bya ;
analyzed: lnga pa yis kyang longs spyod bya ;
translated: even by the fifth.

original: / zhes bya ba la pho nya mo las rtag tu zhen pa las grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bzhin du gzung 'dzin gnyis las 'das pa'i longs spyod bya ba'o //🔽blang bya'i mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la pho nya mo las rtag tu zhen pa las grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bzhin du gzung 'dzin gnyis las 'das pa'i longs spyod bya ba'o // blang bya'i mdor bstan nas /
translated: The messenger is to be enjoyed, always liberated from attachment, and enjoyed beyond the duality of subject and object, like the bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom.

original: dor bya'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dor bya'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: Having briefly explained the earth to be taken up, the extensive explanation of the earth to be rejected is:

original: skye gnas dman la mi gnas la //
analyzed: skye gnas dman la mi gnas la //
translated: One should not stay in a low birth-place,

original: bsnyen bkur nyid ni bya ba min //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur nyid ni bya ba min // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and one should not serve.

original: skye gnas dman pa ni dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / bsnyen sgrub bzhis ma sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas dman pa ni dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / bsnyen sgrub bzhis ma sbyangs pa'o //
translated: A low birth-place is one who has not received empowerment and has not been purified by the four means of service and practice.

original: mi gnas pa ni 'dod chags kyi zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni 'dod chags kyi zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Not staying means not being attached to desire.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba ma yin pa ni rmongs pas phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa gus pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba ma yin pa ni rmongs pas phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa gus pas mi bya'o //
translated: One should not honor those who are not to be honored, because of delusion, by bowing down to them, etc.

original: blang bar bya ba'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba'i rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of what is to be taken up is:

original: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // chung ma pho nya mo nyid gnas //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // chung ma pho nya mo nyid gnas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One’s mother, sister, daughter, wife, or messenger herself.

original: sngar bstan pa'i sngags skyes rnams so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i sngags skyes rnams so //
translated: The mantra-born ones previously mentioned.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni de dang gtsang sbra rnam pa gsum spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni de dang gtsang sbra rnam pa gsum spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: “Herself” means that she is engaged in the three kinds of purity.

original: pho nya ma gtogs ba la brten pas nyes pa cir 'gyur snyam na /🔽dka' thub nyes pas zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: pho nya ma gtogs ba la brten pas nyes pa cir 'gyur snyam na / dka' thub nyes pas zad par 'gyur //
translated: If one wonders what the fault is of relying on someone other than a messenger,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “The ascetic practice is destroyed by the fault.”

original: bsam gtan dang zag med kyi dka' thub gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa skyes pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag med kyi dka' thub gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa skyes pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascetic practice of meditative concentration and the uncontaminated is destroyed by the arising of the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: blang bar bya bas 'bras bu ji ltar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: blang bar bya bas 'bras bu ji ltar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: As for the result of what is to be taken up, it is said:

original: 'khor lo'am de bzhin grub pa yi //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khor lo'am de bzhin grub pa yi //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The wheel, or likewise, accomplishment.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo tshogs kyi dngos grub bam /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo tshogs kyi dngos grub bam /
translated: the power of the circle of the mandala, or

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten dang mchog gi dngos grub bo //🔽mchog dang tha ma lhan cig gus //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten dang mchog gi dngos grub bo // mchog dang tha ma lhan cig gus //
translated: the power of the world and the supreme.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The supreme and the inferior are summoned together.

original: mchog ye shes las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ye shes las skyes pa'o //
translated: The supreme is born from intuition.

original: tha ma ni sngags las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni sngags las skyes pa'o //
translated: The inferior is born from mantra.

original: shugs kyi bar ma gnas las skyes pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: shugs kyi bar ma gnas las skyes pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: The middling, born from the place, is also included by implication.

original: lhan cig 'gugs zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: lhan cig 'gugs zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The phrase “summoned together”

original: srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'o //
analyzed: srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'o //
translated: means that the life-force enters the avadhūtī.

original: de ltar rdzas rnams nges pa med //
analyzed: de ltar rdzas rnams nges pa med //
translated: Thus, the substances are not definite.

original: ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dga' bral du ma btang bas bde ba @413a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dga' bral du ma btang bas bde ba @413a * //
translated: Thus, the bliss is not lost in the separation of the enlightenment spirit and the mind,

original: rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gyis sdom par nges pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa bsam gtan gyis sdom par nges pa'o //
translated: and the non-conceptual is definitely retained by the meditation.

original: yid ni nang du chud pa yis //
analyzed: yid ni nang du chud pa yis //
translated: The mind is drawn inward

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya //

original: de ltar dga' ba stong pa nyid rnal 'byor bshad nas mchog dga'i stong pa nyid rjes su rnal 'byor bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba stong pa nyid rnal 'byor bshad nas mchog dga'i stong pa nyid rjes su rnal 'byor bshad pa ni /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa // zhes bya ba smos te /

original: dngos grub gsum sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub gsum sgrub par byed pa'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog dga'i rnam par smin pa'i dus su srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'o //

original: des 'bras bu ci 'grub ce na /

original: de dag las 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las 'byung ba yin zhe na /

original: gsang sngags 'di las 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di las 'byung ba yin //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: Having explained the subsequent yoga, the supreme joy, the great emptiness, now, in order to explain the great emptiness, the connate joy, at the time of the fourth stage, the yoga of great purity, the root tantra states:

analyzed: sgrub pa po ni dngos grub rtsom //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba lhan cig skyes pa'i stong pa chen po la rtsom pa'o //

analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyar yang dag ldan //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa dang / phyag rgya chen po yid bde ba nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //

analyzed: phyag rgya dang bral gsang sngags ni //

original: lus can rnams la byin mi rlob //
analyzed: lus can rnams la byin mi rlob //

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: sems kyi stong nyid kyi phyag rgya dang bral na gsang sngags srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud kyang rnal 'byor pa la phyag rgya chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pas byin gyis mi rlob pa'o //
translated: If the mind is not sealed with the seal of emptiness, even if the life-force of mantra enters the avadhūti, the yogin will not be empowered by the inconceivable great seal.

original: stong pa chen po skyes pa'i rtags ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa chen po skyes pa'i rtags ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of the arising of great emptiness?🔽It is said:

analyzed: ji srid dro ba'i bya ba dag / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: As long as the activity of heat

analyzed: gzung ba bkag nas drod kyi ye shes skyes pa dang / stong pa chen po'i rang bzhin bsam gtan dang po'i bde ba la stong pa nyid kyis rgyas btab pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Having stopped the object, the wisdom of heat arises, and the bliss of the first concentration, which is the nature of great emptiness, should be recognized as being sealed with emptiness.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /

original: mnyam sbyor las /
analyzed: mnyam sbyor las /
translated: In the Union with Buddha,🔽it is said:

analyzed: sku gsung thugs la 'debs pas na //

analyzed: shes rab phyag rgya rjes su brjod //

analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / kun spyod las /
translated: it is said:

analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //

analyzed: lha yi sku ni bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //

original: dro ba'i rtags de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dro ba'i rtags de ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: gdan bzhi las /
translated: The Catuhpitha Tantra teaches:

analyzed: dang por shes rab dro ba yin //

original: gnyis pa du mar ldan pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa du mar ldan pa yin //

analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni 'khyud pa dang // bzhi pa mar me 'bar ba ste //
translated: Third, there is the one with embrace, and fourth, the blazing lamp.

analyzed: lnga pa sprin med nam mkha' dang // zhes gsungs so // de ltar lhan cig skyes dga'i stong pa chen po shin tu rnal 'byor bshad nas sems 'od @416a * //

original: gsal dang nyams su myong ba ro gcig gi zung 'jug gi ngo bo rnal 'byor chen po bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsal dang nyams su myong ba ro gcig gi zung 'jug gi ngo bo rnal 'byor chen po bstan pa ni /
translated: Having explained the great yoga of the connate great bliss and great emptiness, the nature of the great yoga of the luminous mind and the single taste of experience is taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin sems 'od gsal ba'i stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ni stong pa chen po'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin sems 'od gsal ba'i stong pa nyid du rtogs pa ni stong pa chen po'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization that the emptiness of all aspects is the nature of the luminous mind is called the nature of great emptiness.

original: rgyu des 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: By that cause, all desired aims are accomplished.

analyzed: sems kyi bde ba chen po dbang bzhi pa thob pa la smad par mi bya bar bstan pa ni /

original: rnal 'byor che la gang zhig sdang // khyi yi skye gnas brgyar skye ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor che la gang zhig sdang // khyi yi skye gnas brgyar skye ste /

original: sme sha can du skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sme sha can du skye bar 'gyur //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: slob dpon ye shes zhabs kyi bzhed pa ltar lha'i sku'i 'khor lo sgyu ma lta bur bsgoms pas /

original: mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: one will attain the supreme attainment.🔽For example,

original: dper na / la la mar ni 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: dper na / la la mar ni 'dod pa yis //

analyzed: 'bad pas chu ni bsrubs gyur kyang //

analyzed: mar sar 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi //

original: lus nyon mongs pa kho nar zad //
analyzed: lus nyon mongs pa kho nar zad //
translated: only the trouble of the body will be exhausted.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'o na bcos ma'i rnal 'byor mas ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na /🔽'dzin cing mchod par byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'o na bcos ma'i rnal 'byor mas ci zhig thob par 'gyur zhe na / 'dzin cing mchod par byed pa ni //
translated: Well then, what will a contrived yoginī attain?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽One who holds and makes offerings to the deity's form🔽will attain the deity's form.

analyzed: lhar bskyed cing mchod pa byed pa na tshe 'di nyid la 'tsho ba'i thabs kyi rgyur gyur pa dang / tshe phyi mar lha dang mi ra skye ba la thar par 'byung ba'i rnal 'byor gzhan la brten pa des ni gzhan du mchog gi dngos grub sgrub pa na /
translated: When one generates the deity and makes offerings, the cause of the means of livelihood in this life and the cause of birth as a god or human in the next life are the other yogas that occur in liberation.

original: de ni sgyu ma yin pas don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sgyu ma yin pas don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is an illusion, it is meaningless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid mngon sum gyis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon sum gyis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness is not meditated on in a direct perception.

original: de rnams kyi don ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of those is taught as follows.🔽After obtaining the wisdom-goddess consort, the bliss of the body is the joy and supreme joy, and the mental bliss is the connate joy that arises after that.

original: ye shes kyi lha mo phyag rgya rnyed nas lus bde ba'i dga' ba dang mchog dga' skyes nas yid bde ba lhan cig skyes dga' de'i rjes thogs la skyes pa yin la dbang bzhi pa'i dus su dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang lhan cig skyes dga' stong pa
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha mo phyag rgya rnyed nas lus bde ba'i dga' ba dang mchog dga' skyes nas yid bde ba lhan cig skyes dga' de'i rjes thogs la skyes pa yin la dbang bzhi pa'i dus su dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang lhan cig skyes dga' stong pa
translated: At the time of the fourth empowerment, the joy, supreme joy, and connate joy are empty.

original: dang shin tu stong pa chen po'i rgyas btab nas gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin sems 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid dbang bzhi pa'i ngo bo thob pa yin no //
analyzed: dang shin tu stong pa chen po'i rgyas btab nas gzung 'dzin gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin sems 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid dbang bzhi pa'i ngo bo thob pa yin no //
translated: Having sealed it with the very empty, one obtains the nature of the fourth empowerment, the identity of the clear-light mind free from the duality of percept and perceiver.

original: dga' ba gsum gyi dus su rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum gyi dus su rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: At the time of the three joys, one is free from the eighty natural concepts.

original: dga' ba gsum stong par shes pa'i dus su bde bar @416b snang ba'i gzung 'dzin nyid nub pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba gsum stong par shes pa'i dus su bde bar @416b snang ba'i gzung 'dzin nyid nub pa yin no //
translated: When one knows the three joys to be empty, the percept and perceiver of the appearance of bliss itself subsides.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa gnyis su snang ba nyid nub na ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa gnyis su snang ba nyid nub na ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the appearance of the two types of concepts subsides in that way, what happens?

original: bzhi pa rnal 'byor chen po 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa rnal 'byor chen po 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourth, the great yoga, becomes the nature of clear light.

original: de la rang bzhin brgyad cu ni dga' ba'i tshe rtog pa sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mchog dga'i tshe bzhi bcu tham pa dang / lhan cig skyes dga'i tshe rnam pa bdun dang bral bas na rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin brgyad cu ni dga' ba'i tshe rtog pa sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mchog dga'i tshe bzhi bcu tham pa dang / lhan cig skyes dga'i tshe rnam pa bdun dang bral bas na rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the eighty natures are as follows: At the time of joy, one is free from the thirty-three concepts; at the time of supreme joy, one is free from the forty concepts; and at the time of connate joy, one is free from the seven aspects, and therefore there are no concepts.

original: de yang stong pa nyid bdun cu ba'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid bdun cu ba'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Commentary on the “Seventy Verses on Emptiness” says:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba bar ma dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yid kyis 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / mya ngan dang / mya ngan par ma dang / shin tu mya ngan du gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba bar ma dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yid kyis 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / mya ngan dang / mya ngan par ma dang / shin tu mya ngan du gyur ba dang /
translated: The desireless, the moderately desireless, and the very desireless; the mentally going, coming, grieving, moderately grieving, and very grieving;

original: zhi ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa bar ma dang / shin tu 'jigs pa dang / sred pa dang / sred pa par ma dang / shin tu sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / mi dge ba dang /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs pa bar ma dang / shin tu 'jigs pa dang / sred pa dang / sred pa par ma dang / shin tu sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / mi dge ba dang /
translated: the peaceful, the conceptual, the fearful, the moderately fearful, and the very fearful; the craving, the moderately craving, and the very craving; the appropriating, the nonvirtuous,

original: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba bar ma dang / shin tu tshor ba dang / rig pa po dang / 'dzin pa'i gzhi pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / snying rje dang /
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba bar ma dang / shin tu tshor ba dang / rig pa po dang / 'dzin pa'i gzhi pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / snying rje dang /
translated: the hungry, the thirsty, the feeling, the moderately feeling, and the very feeling; the knower, the basis of grasping, the discerning, the ashamed, the compassionate,🔽and the very compassionate.

original: brtse ba dang / brtse ba bar ma dang / shin tu brtse ba dang / dgongs pa dang bcas pa dang / sdud pa dang / phrag dog ste /
analyzed: brtse ba dang / brtse ba bar ma dang / shin tu brtse ba dang / dgongs pa dang bcas pa dang / sdud pa dang / phrag dog ste /
translated: encompassing, and envy.

original: mtshan nyid sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: These are the thirty-three characteristics.🔽The nature of method is attachment, middling attachment, and great attachment,🔽joy, middling joy, and great joy,

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin ni chags pa dang / chags pa bar ma dang / kun du chags pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' ba bar ma dang / shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / rab tu mgu ba dang / ngo mtshar ba dang /
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin ni chags pa dang / chags pa bar ma dang / kun du chags pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' ba bar ma dang / shin tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / rab tu mgu ba dang / ngo mtshar ba dang /
translated: delight, great delight, and wonder,

original: dgod pa dang / tshim pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / 'jib pa dang / ba rtags pa dang / btsog pa dang / khengs pa dang / bya ba dang / 'phrog pa dang / stong pa dang / 'phro ba dang /
analyzed: dgod pa dang / tshim pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / 'jib pa dang / ba rtags pa dang / btsog pa dang / khengs pa dang / bya ba dang / 'phrog pa dang / stong pa dang / 'phro ba dang /
translated: laughter, satisfaction, embracing, kissing, sucking, biting, scratching, swelling, action, stealing, emptiness, distraction,

original: dga' ba la sbyor ba dang / dga' ba la sbyor ba bar ma dang / shin tu dga' ba la sbyor ba dang / drag pa dang / rnam par sgeg pa dang / 'gras pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / tshig gsal ba dang / bden pa dang /
analyzed: dga' ba la sbyor ba dang / dga' ba la sbyor ba bar ma dang / shin tu dga' ba la sbyor ba dang / drag pa dang / rnam par sgeg pa dang / 'gras pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / tshig gsal ba dang / bden pa dang /
translated: the one who is applied to joy, the one who is applied to middling joy, the one who is applied to great joy, the one who is intense, the one who is flirtatious, the one who is angry, the one who is quarrelsome, the one who is clear-spoken, the one who is truthful,

original: mi bden pa dang / nges pa dang / nye bar mi len pa dang / sbyin pa po dang / skul pa po dang / dga' ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgrin @417a * //
analyzed: mi bden pa dang / nges pa dang / nye bar mi len pa dang / sbyin pa po dang / skul pa po dang / dga' ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgrin @417a * //
translated: the one who is untruthful, the one who is certain, the one who is not grasping, the one who is generous, the one who is encouraging, the one who is joyful, the one who is shameless, the one who is prudent,

original: pa dang / gdug pa dang / mi srun pa dang / gya gyu che ba dang / mtshan nyid bzhi bcu tham pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / gdug pa dang / mi srun pa dang / gya gyu che ba dang / mtshan nyid bzhi bcu tham pa'o //
translated: the one who is malicious, the one who is unruly, the one who is very deceitful, and the one who is of forty characteristics.

original: snang ba thob pa dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snang ba thob pa dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the attainment of light and wisdom is as follows:

original: chags pa bar ma dang / brjed ngas pa dang / 'khrul ba dang / mi smra ba dang / smyo ba dang / le lo dang / the tshom dang / bcas pas te 'di ni rang bzhin bdun po de dag go //
analyzed: chags pa bar ma dang / brjed ngas pa dang / 'khrul ba dang / mi smra ba dang / smyo ba dang / le lo dang / the tshom dang / bcas pas te 'di ni rang bzhin bdun po de dag go //
translated: the middling one who is attached, the one who is forgetful, the one who is deluded, the one who is silent, the one who is insane, the one who is lazy, the one who is doubtful, and the one who is restrained. These are the seven natures.

original: rang bzhin brgyad cu po de dag gzung bar snang ba mtshan mo'i sems dang / 'dzin par snang ba nyin mo'i sems kyis phye nas rang bzhin brgya drug cur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin brgyad cu po de dag gzung bar snang ba mtshan mo'i sems dang / 'dzin par snang ba nyin mo'i sems kyis phye nas rang bzhin brgya drug cur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When these eighty natures are divided into the mind of the night, which appears as the apprehended, and the mind of the day, which appears as the apprehender, they become one hundred and sixty natures.🔽Moreover, the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyi'i sems la sems zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyi'i sems la sems zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: One should know that the external mind is called the mind.

original: nang gi sems la sems zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nang gi sems la sems zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should know that the internal mind is called the mind.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gzung 'dzin gnyis nub nas gnyis su snang ba gsum stong pa gsum gyis bkag nas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba rtogs pa ni sa dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gzung 'dzin gnyis nub nas gnyis su snang ba gsum stong pa gsum gyis bkag nas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba rtogs pa ni sa dang po yin no //
translated: Thus, when the two, the apprehended and apprehender, which are conceptual thoughts, have set, the three appearances are blocked by the three emptinesses, and the realization of the natural luminosity free from adventitious defilements is the first ground.

original: de'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
translated: The benefits of that are stated:

original: rnal 'byor che mchog dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor che mchog dpa' bo ni //
translated: The supreme hero of yoga

original: yul phyogs gang na gnas gyur ba'i //
analyzed: yul phyogs gang na gnas gyur ba'i //
translated: Wherever he dwells,

original: rigs ngan kla klo yin na yang //
analyzed: rigs ngan kla klo yin na yang //
translated: Even if he is a low-caste barbarian,

original: yul de yongs su brtags pa yin //
analyzed: yul de yongs su brtags pa yin //
translated: That place is considered pure.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnal 'byor pa mchog tu gyur pa sems kyi stong nyid rtogs pa'i dpa' bo de ni yul gang na gnas kyang rdo rje'i gdan yin la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mchog tu gyur pa sems kyi stong nyid rtogs pa'i dpa' bo de ni yul gang na gnas kyang rdo rje'i gdan yin la //
translated: The hero who has realized the emptiness of mind, the supreme yogi, wherever he may be, is the vajra seat.

original: rigs ni kla klor skyes kyang sprul pa'i sku dngos yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni kla klor skyes kyang sprul pa'i sku dngos yin no //
translated: Even if born in a barbarian land, he is the actual nirmāṇakāya.

original: rnal 'byor pa sems kyi stong nyid shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sems kyi stong nyid shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If the yogi knows the emptiness of mind, will he be blessed by other tathāgatas?

original: sems can yongs su gzung ba'i rgyur //
analyzed: sems can yongs su gzung ba'i rgyur //
translated: For the sake of protecting sentient beings,

original: de rung ni rtag tu gnas //
analyzed: de rung ni rtag tu gnas //
translated: he always abides there.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang sngon gyi lam rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa de rjes su gzung ba'i phyir yul der rtag tu bzhugs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang sngon gyi lam rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa de rjes su gzung ba'i phyir yul der rtag tu bzhugs pa yin no ;
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas of the past and present always abide in that place for the sake of protecting the yogi who has realized the path in the past.

original: / de yang padma rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: / de yang padma rdo rje'i zhal snga nas /
translated: Moreover, Padmavajra says:

original: cig car phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa gsungs pa dang / de dang rjes su mthun par ni kha sbyor thig le las sems kyi stong nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: cig car phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa gsungs pa dang / de dang rjes su mthun par ni kha sbyor thig le las sems kyi stong nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: and the simultaneous meditation on the great seal, and in accordance with that, the Tantra of the Drop of Union teaches the realization of the emptiness of mind by direct perception.

original: 'dir ni bshad pa'i rgyud kun spyod dang / rjes su mthun par dga' ba bzhi la @417b rim gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni bshad pa'i rgyud kun spyod dang / rjes su mthun par dga' ba bzhi la @417b rim gyis stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i tshul gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Here, in accordance with the explanatory tantra Samantabhadra, it is explained that the four joys are realized in sequence, by the method of realizing emptiness.

original: de yang las kyi phyag rgya la brten nas dga' ba gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang las kyi phyag rgya la brten nas dga' ba gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the meditative stabilization of the three joys is generated in dependence on the karmamudra.

original: phyag rgya chen po la brten nas dga' ba gsum gyi stong pa nyid rtogs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la brten nas dga' ba gsum gyi stong pa nyid rtogs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Having realized the emptiness of the three joys in dependence on the mahamudra, it becomes the nature of clear light.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu ba'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu ba'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the twenty-ninth chapter on the perfection stage of the great yoga of the Guhyasamaja.

original: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rgyas par bshad pa ni le'u lnga bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba'i srung ba'i 'khor lo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rgyas par bshad pa ni le'u lnga bshad nas bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba'i srung ba'i 'khor lo bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, having explained the extensive explanation of the completion stage, the teaching of the protection wheel that is preceded by the generation stage is as follows.

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
translated: Next, I will explain🔽the layout of the wheel of the syllables of Sumbha.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽shin tu rnyed dka' dgod pa ste ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / shin tu rnyed dka' dgod pa ste ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: gnod mdzes kyi yi ge btu ba'i 'khor lo dgod pa'o //🔽gang zhig gshes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi yi ge btu ba'i 'khor lo dgod pa'o // gang zhig gshes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: The layout of the wheel of the syllables of Sumbha.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽The one who merely knows

original: btus pa'i 'khrul 'khor shes pa'o //
analyzed: btus pa'i 'khrul 'khor shes pa'o //
translated: the layout of the wheel of the syllables of Sumbha🔽will be able to accomplish all activities.

original: de yang bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: de yang bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: Moreover, in the explanatory tantra Vajraḍāka, it is said:

original: sgra gcan 'dzin gyi rgyu ba rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros dang / phur bu rgyu ba yi dags srin po'i gdong dang / spen pa'i rgyu ba gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba dang / mjug rings rgyu ba ma mo'i rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo bkod pa shes pa tsam gyis las bcu gnyis kyi dngos grub myur du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin gyi rgyu ba rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros dang / phur bu rgyu ba yi dags srin po'i gdong dang / spen pa'i rgyu ba gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba dang / mjug rings rgyu ba ma mo'i rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo bkod pa shes pa tsam gyis las bcu gnyis kyi dngos grub myur du sgrub par byed do //
translated: By merely knowing the movements of Rāhu, which are the gait of a horse, the movements of Ketu, which are the face of a hungry ghost or rākṣasa, the movements of Śukra, which are Yama holding a club, and the movements of Śani, which are the wheel of the retinue of the class of mātṛkā, one will quickly accomplish the spiritual powers of the twelve houses.

original: rgyud bla ma'i le'u bzhi pa las gnod mdzes kyi sngags btu ba shes pa tsam gyis srung ba'i 'khor lo byas pas bar chad kyi bgegs med par byas nas dngos grub sgrub pa'i 'khor lo sum cu rtsa bzhi myur du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud bla ma'i le'u bzhi pa las gnod mdzes kyi sngags btu ba shes pa tsam gyis srung ba'i 'khor lo byas pas bar chad kyi bgegs med par byas nas dngos grub sgrub pa'i 'khor lo sum cu rtsa bzhi myur du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: By merely knowing how to extract the mantra of Sumbha from the fourth chapter of the Unexcelled Tantra, and by creating a protection wheel, one will eliminate obstacles and quickly accomplish the thirty-four wheels of siddhi.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud gnyis kyi dgongs pa dang ldan pa'i yi ge btu ba'i gnas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud gnyis kyi dgongs pa dang ldan pa'i yi ge btu ba'i gnas bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the places of extracting the syllables endowed with the intention of the two explanatory tantras is as follows:

original: sa yi cha mnyam yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: sa yi cha mnyam yid 'ong ba //
translated: A delightful and even part of the earth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: yi ge btu ba'i gnas dang / yi ge btu ba'i gzhi'i 'khor lo dang / btu ba'i thabs dang / sgrub pa'i cho ga bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge btu ba'i gnas dang / yi ge btu ba'i gzhi'i 'khor lo dang / btu ba'i thabs dang / sgrub pa'i cho ga bshad pa yin no //
translated: The place of selecting the syllables, the wheel of the basis of selecting the syllables, the method of selecting, and the explanation of the rite of accomplishment.

original: de nas gnas cha mnyam zhing yid du 'ong ba la tsandan dang / ga pur la sogs pas byugs pa'i dri bzang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas cha mnyam zhing yid du 'ong ba la tsandan dang / ga pur la sogs pas byugs pa'i dri bzang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Then, in a place that is even and pleasing, anointed with good scents such as sandalwood and camphor,

original: sa ba'i ko ba tsam byug pa la me tog gi sil ma gcal du bkram zhing phyogs bzhir spos snod bzhi bzhag pa'i dris nyams dga' bar gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i shar phyogs kyi @418a * //
analyzed: sa ba'i ko ba tsam byug pa la me tog gi sil ma gcal du bkram zhing phyogs bzhir spos snod bzhi bzhag pa'i dris nyams dga' bar gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i shar phyogs kyi @418a * //
translated: smeared with a thickness like a cow's hide, strewn with loose flowers, and in the four directions there are four incense burners, the maṇḍala becomes delightful with scent.

original: char bdag nyid 'dug la /
analyzed: char bdag nyid 'dug la /
translated: In the eastern part of that maṇḍala,

original: gos dang phyag rgya lnga dang shes rab kyi yan lag dang / bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad bskyed pa'i cho ga kun byas shing /
analyzed: gos dang phyag rgya lnga dang shes rab kyi yan lag dang / bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad bskyed pa'i cho ga kun byas shing /
translated: one should sit, wearing clothes, the five symbolic ornaments, and the branch of wisdom, and having performed the rite of generating oneself as Vajra Hūṃkara.

original: khro bo bcus phyogs bcing ba byas nas phur bus btab cing rab dang dra ba dang me 'od kyi phreng ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du srung ba'i 'khor lo bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo bcus phyogs bcing ba byas nas phur bus btab cing rab dang dra ba dang me 'od kyi phreng ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du srung ba'i 'khor lo bya'o //
translated: Having made the ten wrathful ones bind the ten directions, one should make the protection wheel by means of the stakes, the enclosure, the net, and the garland of flames.

original: de nas / ba yi rnam lnga bcing byas te //
analyzed: de nas / ba yi rnam lnga bcing byas te //
translated: Then, “having bound the five ambrosias,”

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos su rdza rnga rnyed na re mig la yi ge dgod pa'am /🔽sa la rdza rnga'i dbyibs bris la re'u mig pa bzhi bcu rtsa dgu cha mnyam la rdza rnga kha bzhi pa ri mo dgu pas yongs su bskor ba bris la rdza rnga'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams la yi ge'i phyi rim pa bzhin du re mig dang mnyam par
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos su rdza rnga rnyed na re mig la yi ge dgod pa'am / sa la rdza rnga'i dbyibs bris la re'u mig pa bzhi bcu rtsa dgu cha mnyam la rdza rnga kha bzhi pa ri mo dgu pas yongs su bskor ba bris la rdza rnga'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams la yi ge'i phyi rim pa bzhin du re mig dang mnyam par
translated: if one actually finds a clay drum, one should write the syllables on the squares.

original: bya ba'i bsam pas rnal 'byor shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i bsam pas dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i bsam pas rnal 'byor shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i bsam pas dgod par bya'o //
translated: Or, having drawn the shape of a clay drum on the ground, one should draw forty-nine equal squares, and having drawn a four-sided drum completely surrounded by nine lines, one should begin in one direction of the drum and, with the intention of writing the outer circle of syllables in the same order as the squares, one should write the syllables with the intention of being in a very equipoised yoga.

original: shar lho du ba'i mdog can ni shar dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: shar lho du ba'i mdog can ni shar dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The southeast face is the color of smoke. It is like the eastern face.

original: bden bral nag po yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bden bral nag po yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The southwest face is black. It is like the eastern face.

original: rlung gi sngo ba yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi sngo ba yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The northwest face is blue. It is like the eastern face.

original: byang shar yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: byang shar yang shar dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The northeast face is like the eastern face.

original: steng dkar po g-yas sngo ba dang g-yon ljang ba'o //
analyzed: steng dkar po g-yas sngo ba dang g-yon ljang ba'o //
translated: The upper face is white. The right face is blue. The left face is green.

original: 'og kyang shar phyogs dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'og kyang shar phyogs dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The lower face is like the eastern face.

original: shar rdo rje dang / byang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / nub padma dang / lhor ni rin po che dril bu dang bcas pa bsnams pas 'khyud pa'o ;
analyzed: shar rdo rje dang / byang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / nub padma dang / lhor ni rin po che dril bu dang bcas pa bsnams pas 'khyud pa'o ;
translated: The eastern face holds a vajra, the northern face holds a variegated vajra, the western face holds a lotus, and the southern face holds a jewel with a bell.

original: / phyag lhag ma rnams kyis lcags kyu dang kha tv'am ga dang / tri sh'u la dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: / phyag lhag ma rnams kyis lcags kyu dang kha tv'am ga dang / tri sh'u la dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: The remaining hands hold a hook, a khatvanga, a trident, and a skull cup.

original: steng gi 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo dang dril bus 'khyud cing 'og gi gnod mdzes ni rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
analyzed: steng gi 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo dang dril bus 'khyud cing 'og gi gnod mdzes ni rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
translated: The upper face of Cakrasaṃvara embraces a wheel and a bell, and the lower face of Sumbha embraces a vajra and a bell.

original: phyag lhag ma ni snga ma rnams dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag lhag ma ni snga ma rnams dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The remaining hands are the same as before.🔽In this way, the ten wrathful ones emanate, scare away the temporary obstructors, gather back, and trample on the ten directions as seats.

original: de lta bu'i khro bo bcu spros pas glo bur gyi bgegs rnams bskrad nas bsdus pas phyogs skyong bcu gdan du bting zhing bgegs gzhom pa'i phyir stod khro bo smad phur bu rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bu /
analyzed: de lta bu'i khro bo bcu spros pas glo bur gyi bgegs rnams bskrad nas bsdus pas phyogs skyong bcu gdan du bting zhing bgegs gzhom pa'i phyir stod khro bo smad phur bu rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bu /
translated: In order to destroy obstructors, the upper body is wrathful and the lower body is a single-pointed vajra dagger.

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'am h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'am h'um h'um phat /

original: k'i li k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: k'i li k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um h'um phat /
translated: Kīlaya kīlaya sarvapāpaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: h'um h'um h'um badzra k'i la ya phat /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um badzra k'i la ya phat /
translated: Hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ vajrakīlaya vajradhara ājñāpayati kāyavākcittavajrakīlaya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti k'a ya w'a ka tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um h'um phat ces bya bas khro bo bcu bskyed la bgegs kyi snying gar gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti k'a ya w'a ka tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'um h'um phat ces bya bas khro bo bcu bskyed la bgegs kyi snying gar gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having generated the ten wrathful ones, one should stab the heart of the obstructors with this.🔽Oṃ vajra muṃgāra ākotaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra munggar a'a ko ta ya h'um phat ces brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra munggar a'a ko ta ya h'um phat ces brdung bar bya'o //
translated: One should beat with this.🔽Then, from hūṃ, one should imagine a vajra ground,

original: de nas h'um las rdo rje sa gzhi dang / de'i 'od zer gyis @420a * //
analyzed: de nas h'um las rdo rje sa gzhi dang / de'i 'od zer gyis @420a * //
translated: and with its light

original: rab dang / steng du rdo rje bla re dang / mda'i dra ba dang / phyi rol kun nas me 'od kyi phreng ba bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rab dang / steng du rdo rje bla re dang / mda'i dra ba dang / phyi rol kun nas me 'od kyi phreng ba bsam par bya'o //
translated: a vajra tent above, a net of arrows, and a garland of blazing fire all around outside.🔽Then,

original: de nas / khro bo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: de nas / khro bo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with the four wrathful ones,

original: lha brgyad dang ni yang dag ldan //
analyzed: lha brgyad dang ni yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with the eight gods,

original: zhes bya ba gnod mdzes kyi spro ba'i sngags bzhi las khro bo bskyed pa dang yang dag ldan pa dang / phur bu'i sku brgyad bskyed pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnod mdzes kyi spro ba'i sngags bzhi las khro bo bskyed pa dang yang dag ldan pa dang / phur bu'i sku brgyad bskyed pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Thus, the four emanation mantras of Sumbharāja are complete with the generation of the wrathful ones and the generation of the eight bodies of the dagger.

original: de lta bu bsgoms pas rgyud thams cad du thun mong du brjod pa'i sngags 'di dang / bsgom pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo dang bcas bcu gnyis kyi 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu bsgoms pas rgyud thams cad du thun mong du brjod pa'i sngags 'di dang / bsgom pa'i khro bo'i 'khor lo dang bcas bcu gnyis kyi 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
translated: By meditating in this way, the result of the twelve, this mantra which is common to all tantras and the mandala of the wrathful ones to be meditated upon, is generated.

original: btus pa'o // btus pa'i sngags 'di nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: btus pa'o // btus pa'i sngags 'di nyid gang zhe na /
translated: This very collected mantra is what?

analyzed: aom sumbha zhes pa la sogs pa ste sumbha ni gnod mdzes la bod pa'o // grihna zhes bya ba ni khro bo bcu la phyogs skyong ba zung zhig pa'o //
translated: Om sumbha... and so forth. Sumbha is addressed to Sumbharaja.🔽 Grihana means grasp the guardians of the directions to the ten wrathful ones.

original: grihn'a pa ya zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i 'khor gyis zung zhig pa'o //
analyzed: grihn'a pa ya zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i 'khor gyis zung zhig pa'o //
translated: Grihanapaya means grasp to the emanated retinue.

original: a'a na ya ho zhes bya ba ni khu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: a'a na ya ho zhes bya ba ni khu gcig pa'o //
translated: Anayaho means come here.

original: gal te ma khugs na ;
analyzed: gal te ma khugs na ;
translated: If they do not come,

original: ji ltar bya zhin /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhin /
translated: what should be done?

original: bha ga w'am badzra r'a dza zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bha ga w'am badzra r'a dza zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Bhagavat Vajraraja, he says.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rgyal po'i bkas khug cig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rgyal po'i bkas khug cig pa'o //
translated: By the order of the Blessed Vajraraja,  summon!

original: le'u sum cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u sum cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: The explanation of the thirtieth chapter.

original: // / de ltar gnod mdzes kyi 'khor lo bshad na /
analyzed: // / de ltar gnod mdzes kyi 'khor lo bshad na /
translated: Having explained the mandala of Sumbha,

original: dngos grub sgrub pa'i le'u bzhi pa las dang por re zhig rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo le'u nyi shu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos grub sgrub pa'i le'u bzhi pa las dang por re zhig rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo le'u nyi shu gsungs pa ni /
translated: in the fourth chapter on the accomplishment of powers, first of all the twenty-third chapter on the moving and unmoving mandalas is taught.

original: de nas sha chen 'di dag kun //
analyzed: de nas sha chen 'di dag kun //
translated: Then all these great meats,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says.

analyzed: sha chen ni 'chad par gyur pa'i sreg rdzas so //

original: 'jigs byed ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal 'joms pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs byed ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal 'joms pas so //
translated: The terrific is because of the destruction of afflictions and suffering.

original: rdo rje skyes yin zhes bya ba ni mngon spyod kyi rdzas rdo rje'i rigs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skyes yin zhes bya ba ni mngon spyod kyi rdzas rdo rje'i rigs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The vajra-born are the substances of the fierce rite that are in accord with the vajra family.
