original: de ltar dpal he ru ka'i nus pa 'dod pas mgo nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su khyer nas sgrub pa po rlung bzlog pa'i sngags kyi lus can skye rgan 'chi'i chu bo bzhi las brgal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dpal he ru ka'i nus pa 'dod pas mgo nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su khyer nas sgrub pa po rlung bzlog pa'i sngags kyi lus can skye rgan 'chi'i chu bo bzhi las brgal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who desires the power of Sri Heruka should carry the head to the place of the mandala in the sky, and the adept, whose body is the mantra of reversing the wind, will cross over the four rivers of birth, old age, and death.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the thirty-ninth chapter.

original: // / de ltar dngos grub kyi dus bshad nas dbang du bya ba'i sbyin sreg bshad pa ni /
analyzed: // / de ltar dngos grub kyi dus bshad nas dbang du bya ba'i sbyin sreg bshad pa ni /
translated: Having explained the time of power, now the burnt offering for subjugation is explained.

original: de nas da ni bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas da ni bshad bya ba //
translated: Now, what is to be explained

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: da ni @431b thabs gang gis rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i mi rnams dbang du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor dang / sngags dang sbyin sreg gi cho ga la gnas pa'i dpa' bos zla ba gcig gis grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni @431b thabs gang gis rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i mi rnams dbang du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor dang / sngags dang sbyin sreg gi cho ga la gnas pa'i dpa' bos zla ba gcig gis grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, by whatever means the yogi, who abides in the rite of mantra and burnt offering, the hero, will accomplish the subjugation of the people of the royal caste and so forth in one month.

original: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: Having explained that in brief, the extensive explanation is:

original: sgrol ma myos byed bcas pa dang ; nya yi sha dang ldan par ni //
analyzed: sgrol ma myos byed bcas pa dang ; nya yi sha dang ldan par ni //
translated: Tara, with intoxicants, and with fish flesh,

original: zhes bya bas sreg rdzas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sreg rdzas bstan te /
translated: Thus he teaches the sacrificial substances.

original: sgron ma ni sha chen lnga'o //
analyzed: sgron ma ni sha chen lnga'o //
translated: The lamp is the five great meats.

original: myos byed ni chang ngo //
analyzed: myos byed ni chang ngo //
translated: The intoxicant is alcohol.

original: nya sha dang ldan pa ni nya sha dang bcas pa'i khrag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nya sha dang ldan pa ni nya sha dang bcas pa'i khrag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with fish means endowed with blood together with fish.

original: dpa' dbang gnas skabs thams cad du //
analyzed: dpa' dbang gnas skabs thams cad du //
translated: The hero, the lord of heroes, in all circumstances,

original: zhes bya ba ni lhar bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhar bsgom pa ste /
translated: Thus he teaches the meditation on the deity.

original: dpa' bo ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The hero is the yogi.

original: dpa' bo'i dbang po ni dpal he ru kar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i dbang po ni dpal he ru kar bsgom pa'o //
translated: The lord of heroes is the meditation on glorious Heruka.

original: gnas skabs thams cad ni thun bzhir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad ni thun bzhir ro //
translated: In all circumstances means in the four periods.

original: nyi ma bdun gyis sgrub byed cing //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyis sgrub byed cing //
translated: The one to be accomplished by the seven suns🔽Thus he teaches the external fire sacrifice endowed with samadhi in the four periods.

original: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhir ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi sbyin sreg bya ba'am //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhir ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi sbyin sreg bya ba'am //
translated: This is the external fire sacrifice with the concentration of the four periods.

original: mtshan mo sbyin sreg byed la gzhol //
analyzed: mtshan mo sbyin sreg byed la gzhol //
translated: he is devoted to the night fire sacrifice.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i dus su mtshan mo phyag rgya lnga la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pas nang gi sbyin sreg byas nas dbang du byed pa la sogs pa dngos grub rgya chen po bcu gnyis stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i dus su mtshan mo phyag rgya lnga la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang ldan pas nang gi sbyin sreg byas nas dbang du byed pa la sogs pa dngos grub rgya chen po bcu gnyis stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the bestowal of the twelve great powers, such as subjugation, by performing the fire sacrifice at night with the five symbolic seals, etc., endowed with the conduct, at the time of performing the gaṇacakra.

original: rgyal rigs la phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg grangs du dang ldan par bya zhe na /🔽brgya rtsa brgyad dang ldan nyid kyis //
analyzed: rgyal rigs la phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg grangs du dang ldan par bya zhe na / brgya rtsa brgyad dang ldan nyid kyis //
translated: How many times should the outer and inner fire sacrifices be performed for the kṣatriya?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, endowed with one hundred and eight.

original: grangs brgya rtsa brgyad dang ldan pas thun gsum du phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg brgya byed na rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang bcas pa zhag bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs brgya rtsa brgyad dang ldan pas thun gsum du phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg brgya byed na rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang bcas pa zhag bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with one hundred and eight, if one performs one hundred outer and inner fire sacrifices in three sessions, in seven days the king and his four divisions of troops will be subjugated.

original: de'i phyed lnga bcu rtsa bzhis nyi ma bdun sbyin sreg byas na dpa' bo chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i phyed lnga bcu rtsa bzhis nyi ma bdun sbyin sreg byas na dpa' bo chen po ste /
translated: By performing the fire sacrifice for seven days with one half, fifty-four, the great hero,

original: rgyal tshab dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal tshab dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: the crown prince, will be subjugated.

original: de'i phyed zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun sbyin sreg byas na slob dpon dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyed zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun sbyin sreg byas na slob dpon dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations for twenty-seven half-days, the master will be brought under one's control.

original: rgyal phran rnams la ni grangs sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis nyi ma bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal phran rnams la ni grangs sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis nyi ma bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the vassal kings, in thirty-two days, in seven days, they will be brought under one's control.

original: grangs nyi shu rtsa bzhis bram ze rnams la nyi ma bdun gyis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grangs nyi shu rtsa bzhis bram ze rnams la nyi ma bdun gyis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the Brahmins, in twenty-four days, in seven days, by offering oblations, they will be brought under one's control.

original: de bzhin du rgyal rigs dag la bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ba dang / rje'u rigs lnga dang / dmangs rigs la gsum dang / tha ma ste @432a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal rigs dag la bdun gyis dbang du 'gyur ba dang / rje'u rigs lnga dang / dmangs rigs la gsum dang / tha ma ste @432a * //
translated: In the same way, in seven days, the Kshatriyas will be brought under one's control, the Vaishyas in five, the Shudras in three, and the lowest🔽outcastes in one.

original: gdol pa can rnams la rdzas re re zhing thun bzhir sbyin sreg gzhag bdun byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdol pa can rnams la rdzas re re zhing thun bzhir sbyin sreg gzhag bdun byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations for seven days, in each of the four periods of the day, with each substance, they will be brought under one's control.

original: de ltar dpa' bo'i rigs rim gyis //
analyzed: de ltar dpa' bo'i rigs rim gyis //
translated: Thus, in the sequence of the hero's clan,

original: zla ba gcig ni yang dag spyad //
analyzed: zla ba gcig ni yang dag spyad //
translated: one should practice for one month.

original: ces bya ba ni gal te zhag bdun gyis ma grub na zla ba gcig gis bskyar ba'i cho gas bskyang bar byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te zhag bdun gyis ma grub na zla ba gcig gis bskyar ba'i cho gas bskyang bar byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not succeed in seven days, one should continue for one month, repeating the rite.

original: sngags dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos ba sham ku ru ho zhes bya ba'i sngags dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i 'gro ba thams cad dbang du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sngags dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos ba sham ku ru ho zhes bya ba'i sngags dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i 'gro ba thams cad dbang du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The adept endowed with the mantra, with the mantra “vaśaṃ kuru hoḥ,” the adept endowed with the mantra, all beings of the kṣatriya class, etc., will be brought under control.

original: dpa' bo'i cho ga 'di yis ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i cho ga 'di yis ni //
translated: By this rite of the hero,

original: 'dod pa bsten nas grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa bsten nas grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will be successful by relying on desire.

original: zhes bya ba ni phan yon ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phan yon ston pa yin te /
translated: This shows the benefits.

original: dbang du bya ba'i cho ga 'di bzhin du las bcu gnyis gang 'dod pa la phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg 'di bsten na grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i cho ga 'di bzhin du las bcu gnyis gang 'dod pa la phyi dang nang gi sbyin sreg 'di bsten na grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on this external and internal burnt offering rite of subjugation, one will be successful in whatever twelve rites one desires.

original: sa steng 'dod pa'i dbang phyug bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba thob pa'am /
analyzed: sa steng 'dod pa'i dbang phyug bzhin // zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba thob pa'am /
translated: Like the lord of desire on the face of the earth,🔽this shows the attainment of a human universal monarch.

original: dpal ldan skal ba bzang por 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan skal ba bzang por 'gyur //
translated: Or one will become glorious and fortunate,

original: zhes bya ba ni brgya byin la sogs pa lha'i 'khor los sgyur bar gyur pa'am //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brgya byin la sogs pa lha'i 'khor los sgyur bar gyur pa'am //
translated: this shows becoming a divine universal monarch such as Śakra, etc.

original: sgrub pa pos mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug gi yid du 'ong ba la //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug gi yid du 'ong ba la //
translated: The adept, by relying on the thirty-six ḍākinīs,

original: dpal 'khor lo bde mchog lta bu mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo bde mchog lta bu mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme attainment is like the glorious Cakrasaṃvara.

original: le'u bzhi bcu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fortieth chapter, “The Wheel of the Ritual Actions of the Cakrasaṃvara.”

original: // / de ltar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bcus dngos grub bsgrub pa bshad nas gsang sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor le'u ston pa las /
analyzed: // / de ltar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bcus dngos grub bsgrub pa bshad nas gsang sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor le'u ston pa las /
translated: Having explained the attainment of powers by the ten wheels of the moving and unmoving, now, in order to teach the chapter on the wheel of mantra,

original: dang por re zhig dpa' bo dang dpa' mo thams cad kyi sngags dgod par ston pa ni /🔽de nas las kyi mchog rab ni //
analyzed: dang por re zhig dpa' bo dang dpa' mo thams cad kyi sngags dgod par ston pa ni / de nas las kyi mchog rab ni //
translated: first, in order to teach the arrangement of the mantras of all heroes and heroines,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Then, the supreme ritual action,” and so on.

original: las kyi mchog ni yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: las kyi mchog ni yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: The supreme ritual action is the wheel of syllables.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang gis shes nas dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas mthong ba dang reg pa dang thos pa'i mtshan ma thob pa'i sgrub pa pos dngos grub len pa'i tshe dbang du bya ba'i las bcu gnyis byed pa'am yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang gis shes nas dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas mthong ba dang reg pa dang thos pa'i mtshan ma thob pa'i sgrub pa pos dngos grub len pa'i tshe dbang du bya ba'i las bcu gnyis byed pa'am yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa
translated: The practitioner who knows this, having first relied on the stage of generation, and having obtained the signs of seeing, touching, and hearing, when taking up the powers, performs the twelve ritual actions of magnetizing, or else, having relied on the stage of completion,

original: bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas sa chu la thim pas du ba lta bu dang / chu me la thim pas smig rgyu lta bu dang / me rlung la thim pas srin bu me khyer lta @432b bu dang / rlung rnam par shes pa la thim pas sgron ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas sa chu la thim pas du ba lta bu dang / chu me la thim pas smig rgyu lta bu dang / me rlung la thim pas srin bu me khyer lta @432b bu dang / rlung rnam par shes pa la thim pas sgron ma lta bu dang /
translated: When the signs of dissolution occur for the yogi/nī of meditation—smoke-like when earth dissolves into water, mirage-like when water dissolves into fire, firefly-like when fire dissolves into wind, lamp-like when wind dissolves into consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa nam mkha' la thim pas nam mkha' stong pa lta bu thim pa'i rtags 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nam mkha' la thim pas nam mkha' stong pa lta bu thim pa'i rtags 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: and space-like when consciousness dissolves into space—

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyis 'khrul 'khor 'di rnams byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyis 'khrul 'khor 'di rnams byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: if one performs these yantras with the mantras that will be given below, one will be successful.

original: de la rang gi mtshan ma thob pa de las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa yin la /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan ma thob pa de las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa yin la /
translated: Among them, one who obtains one’s own sign is a beginner yogi/nī.

original: mtshan ma thob pa ni ye shes cung zad tsam la dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa ni ye shes cung zad tsam la dbang ba yin no //
translated: One who obtains the sign has a slight mastery of gnosis.

original: mtshan ma thob pa'i rjes la 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bcu gnyis 'grub pa ni phrin las kyi ye shes la dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa'i rjes la 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bcu gnyis 'grub pa ni phrin las kyi ye shes la dbang ba yin no //
translated: After obtaining the sign, the accomplishment of the twelve mundane siddhis is the mastery of the gnosis of activity.

original: las bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba brtul nas mchog gi dngos grub ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo snod gcig tu za ba'i gtsang sbra dang / zhi ba'i gtsang sbra gsang ba'i dbang bskur gyi gtsang sbra dang / shes rab ye shes pho nya'i gtsang sbras zhi gnas dang /
analyzed: las bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba brtul nas mchog gi dngos grub ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo snod gcig tu za ba'i gtsang sbra dang / zhi ba'i gtsang sbra gsang ba'i dbang bskur gyi gtsang sbra dang / shes rab ye shes pho nya'i gtsang sbras zhi gnas dang /
translated: Having refined the migrating beings with the twelve activities, the supreme spiritual power is the purification of eating the gaṇacakra in a single vessel, the purification of peace, the purification of the secret empowerment, and the purification of the wisdom consort.

original: lhag mthong mngon sum du skyes nas phyag rgya chen po chos kyi dbyings la sems kyi stong nyid bsgoms pas mchog gi dngos grub thob pa ni ye shes la yang dag par dbang ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong mngon sum du skyes nas phyag rgya chen po chos kyi dbyings la sems kyi stong nyid bsgoms pas mchog gi dngos grub thob pa ni ye shes la yang dag par dbang ba'o //
translated: Having generated śamatha and vipaśyanā, the supreme spiritual power is attained by meditating on the emptiness of the mind in the mahāmudrā dharmadhātu.

original: de yang rgyud bla ma las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud bla ma las /
translated: That is also stated in the Unexcelled Āgama:

original: skye ba stong phrag du ma ru //
analyzed: skye ba stong phrag du ma ru //
translated: In many thousands of lifetimes,

original: sgyu 'phrul ye shes kyis bskul ba //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul ye shes kyis bskul ba //
translated: the wisdom of the magical display is aroused,🔽and the wisdom empowerment is obtained

original: sngags dang phyag rgya legs sbyor bas //🔽ye shes la ni dbang thob yin //🔽zhes gsungs pas so ;
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya legs sbyor bas //🔽ye shes la ni dbang thob yin //🔽zhes gsungs pas so ;
translated: by the proper application of mantra and mudra.

original: / de ltar na gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis ni dbang gnyis pa dgug pa dang / gsum pa dbye ba dang / bzhi pa bsad pa dang / lnga pa bskrad pa dang / drug pa rmugs pa dang / bdun pa rengs pa dang /
analyzed: / de ltar na gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis ni dbang gnyis pa dgug pa dang / gsum pa dbye ba dang / bzhi pa bsad pa dang / lnga pa bskrad pa dang / drug pa rmugs pa dang / bdun pa rengs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the twelve perfections of the benefit of others are the second power, summoning; the third, separating; the fourth, killing; the fifth, banishing; the sixth, paralyzing; the seventh, immobilizing;

original: brgyad pa rmongs shing phur bus gdab pa dang / dgu pa tshig 'phrog cing dgug pa dang / bcu pa 'on long du bya ba dang / bcu gcig pa ma ning nyid du bya ba dang / bcu gnyis pa gzugs sna tshogs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa rmongs shing phur bus gdab pa dang / dgu pa tshig 'phrog cing dgug pa dang / bcu pa 'on long du bya ba dang / bcu gcig pa ma ning nyid du bya ba dang / bcu gnyis pa gzugs sna tshogs su gyur pa ste /
translated: the eighth, stupefying and nailing down; the ninth, stealing speech and summoning; the tenth, making deaf and blind; the eleventh, making a eunuch; and the twelfth, changing into various forms.

original: las bcu gnyis po 'di dag bskyed rdzogs la mtshan ma thob pa'i sgrub pa pos 'khrul 'khor dran pa tsam gyis grub par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: las bcu gnyis po 'di dag bskyed rdzogs la mtshan ma thob pa'i sgrub pa pos 'khrul 'khor dran pa tsam gyis grub par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
translated: There is no doubt that these twelve activities are accomplished by the practitioner who has attained signs in the creation and completion stages through merely remembering the yantras.

original: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las gnod mdzes kyi 'khrul 'khor dang sbyar nas las bcu gnyis 'grub par 'gyur gsungs /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro las gnod mdzes kyi 'khrul 'khor dang sbyar nas las bcu gnyis 'grub par 'gyur gsungs /
translated: It is said that the twelve activities are accomplished by applying the yantras of Sumbha from the Vajraḍāka.

original: gnod mdzes kyi 'khor lo ji ltar dgod ce na /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi 'khor lo ji ltar dgod ce na /
translated: How is the wheel of Sumbha arranged?

original: 'jig rten 'khrul 'khor gyi mkhan po gza' chen po brgyad yin la /🔽des @433a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'khrul 'khor gyi mkhan po gza' chen po brgyad yin la / des @433a * //
translated: The eight great planets are the masters of the world's machinery.🔽They bind the machinery of the moving planets and perform twelve actions.

original: gza' rgyu ba'i 'khrul 'khor bcings nas las bcu gnyis byed pas de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las khro bo zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: gza' rgyu ba'i 'khrul 'khor bcings nas las bcu gnyis byed pas de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las khro bo zhes ming du btags so //
translated: The Tantra of the Compendium of Reality names them as wrathful deities.

original: rig pa mchog las gdon gyi gtso bo 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan ma can zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rig pa mchog las gdon gyi gtso bo 'khrul 'khor gyi mtshan ma can zhes bshad do //
translated: The Supreme Knowledge Tantra explains that the chief of the demons is the one with the characteristics of the machinery.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes kyi sngags 'di sgra gcan ltar rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros kyis dgod pa'am /🔽spen pa ltar yi dags srin po'i gdong gis dgod pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes kyi sngags 'di sgra gcan ltar rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros kyis dgod pa'am / spen pa ltar yi dags srin po'i gdong gis dgod pa'am /
translated: The Vajradaka Tantra explains that the Bhagavat Sumbha's mantra is arranged like Rahu, with the gait of a horse, the play of a vajra.🔽It is arranged like Saturn, with the face of a hungry ghost or rakshasa.

original: mig dmar ltar gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang bas dgod pa'am /
analyzed: mig dmar ltar gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang bas dgod pa'am /
translated: It is arranged like Mars, with the club of the Lord of Death.

original: mjug ring sa ltar ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor los dgod pa gsungs pa bzhi po re re la yang 'khrul 'khor bris pa'i gnas mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang / bri ba'i snag tsha dang / smyu gu mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang / ming dang spel ba'i sngags mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang /
analyzed: mjug ring sa ltar ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor los dgod pa gsungs pa bzhi po re re la yang 'khrul 'khor bris pa'i gnas mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang / bri ba'i snag tsha dang / smyu gu mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang / ming dang spel ba'i sngags mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis dang /
translated: It is said that each of these four has twelve different places for drawing the yantras, twelve different inks for drawing them, twelve different pens, twelve different names and mantras for empowering them,

original: lingga'i bye brag mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis kyis 'khrul 'khor re re las bcu gnyis byed pas bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lingga'i bye brag mi 'dra ba bcu gnyis kyis 'khrul 'khor re re las bcu gnyis byed pas bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and twelve different types of lingas. Since each yantra has twelve, there are forty-eight.

original: rgyud bla ma dang he ru ka 'byung ba dang sbyar nas yab kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i 'khrul 'khor dang yum gyi snying po dang dpa' bo'i sngags dang / dpa' mo'i sngags dang / dpa' bo'i go cha'i sngags dang / dpa' mo'i go cha'i sngags dang /
analyzed: rgyud bla ma dang he ru ka 'byung ba dang sbyar nas yab kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i 'khrul 'khor dang yum gyi snying po dang dpa' bo'i sngags dang / dpa' mo'i sngags dang / dpa' bo'i go cha'i sngags dang / dpa' mo'i go cha'i sngags dang /
translated: In the context of the Uttaratantra and the Heruka origin, there are the yantras of the essence and the close essence of the father, the essence of the mother, the hero’s mantra, the heroine’s mantra, the hero’s armor mantra, the heroine’s armor mantra,

original: dpa' bo'i rkang pa brgyad pa dang / dpa' mo'i rkang la brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor te /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rkang pa brgyad pa dang / dpa' mo'i rkang la brgyad pa'i 'khrul 'khor te /
translated: The hero's eight-footed and the heroine's eight-footed yantras.

original: 'khrul 'khor bcu la dbus kyi ni mi 'dra ba ming dang spel ba bcu gnyis bkod pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin na 'khrul 'khor brgya nyi shur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bcu la dbus kyi ni mi 'dra ba ming dang spel ba bcu gnyis bkod pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin na 'khrul 'khor brgya nyi shur 'gyur ro //
translated: If the ten yantras are distinguished by the twelve different arrays of names in the center, there are one hundred and twenty yantras.

original: de ltar dngos grub kyi 'bras bu bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos grub kyi 'bras bu bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the result of power,

original: da ni de'i thabs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de'i thabs gsungs pa ni /
translated: now, the method of that is taught.

original: shar dang byang gi gnas sogs la //
analyzed: shar dang byang gi gnas sogs la //
translated: In the eastern and northern places, etc.,

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni thams cad khyab //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni thams cad khyab //
translated: all dakinis are pervasives.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dngos grub sgrub pa'i tshe gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi na gnas pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dung can ma dang / ri dags can ma dang / padma can dngos grub kyi yan lag tu bsten par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos grub sgrub pa'i tshe gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi na gnas pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dung can ma dang / ri dags can ma dang / padma can dngos grub kyi yan lag tu bsten par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When accomplishing power, it is taught that the karma-consorts who dwell in the twenty-four places, the conch-shell woman, the deer woman, and the lotus woman, are to be relied upon as branches of power.

original: ye shes ldan par rang skye gnas //
analyzed: ye shes ldan par rang skye gnas //
translated: The knowledge-possessor is born in his own birthplace.
